subject: Re: [junit] Database Select query checks!! newbie
msgSnippet: ... Two things: (1) Don t answer an ArrayList; answer a List. If you need to change this to another List implementation, then you have fewer changes to make.
messageBody:
Quoting Deepak C Swamy <deepak_cs_in@...>:

>
> Hi,
>
> I have a method signature like
>
> public ArrayList getAllNews() { }
>
> which queries the DB and gets the Collection of News Beans in an
>
> ArrayList.
>
> what kind of Checks(Tests) can i make (in JUnit) to this method??

Two things:

(1) Don't answer an ArrayList; answer a List. If you need to change this to
another List implementation, then you have fewer changes to make.

(2) Your tests are simple: populate the database with data, write News beans
that represent that data, assert that getAllNews() answers the same Set (or
List, if you care about order within the collection) of News beans. Do this
with as many different datasets as you need to be confident that your method
works.

>
> Also Can anyone pls throw light on ways & depth of Testing that
>
> could be applied on
>
> web application consisting of Classes,EJBs,Servlets etc..

Search the web. This kind of information is not easily found in books, yet. (If
it is and I'm wrong, someone please say so.)

> Is there any site which illustrates Real-time Testing with Junit
>
> apart from addTwoNumbers.etc...stuff ??

Did you mean "real time" in the sense of hard constraints on response times, or
simply "not trivial"? My answer is the same: search the web, try things out and
ask specific questions on this list. Most of the time, it's easier than you
think.

Also try http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JavaUnitBestPractices and start reading as many
links as you can.

Good luck.
